courses.subject: COMP 1501 A
courses.title: Intro to Computer Game Design
courses.description: Introduction to developing mobile applications using the Mac OS X platform. Topics include: the Objective-C programming language; development tools; framework API's; and the Quartz graphic system. Extensive practical experience with development for Apple mobile devices such as the iPhone.
courses.prerequisites: one of COMP 1405, COMP 1005, SYSC 1005, ECOR 1606

courses.subject: COMP 2401 A
courses.title: Introduction to Systems Programming
courses.description: Introduction to system-level programming with fundamental OS concepts, procedures, primitive data types, user-defined types. Topics may include process management, memory management, process coordination and synchronization, inter-process communication, file systems, networking, pointers, heap and stack memory management, and system/library calls. Precludes additional credit for COMP 1002 (no longer offered), COMP 1402 (no longer offered), COMP 2001 (no longer offered), SYSC 2006.
courses.prerequisites: one of COMP 1406, COMP 1006 or SYSC 2004, with a minimum grade of C-

courses.subject: COMP 2402 B
courses.title: Abstract Data Types and Algorithms
courses.description: Introduction to the design and implementation of abstract data types and to complexity analysis of data structures. Topics include: stacks, queues, lists, trees and graphs. Special attention is given to abstraction, interface specification and hierarchical design using an object-oriented programming language.
courses.prerequisites: one of COMP 1406, COMP 1006, SYSC 2004, with a minimum grade of C-.

courses.subject: COMP 2406 A
courses.title: Fundamentals of Web Applications
courses.description: Introduction to Internet application development; emphasis on computer science fundamentals of technologies underlying web applications. Topics include: scripting and functional languages, language-based virtual machines, database query languages, remote procedure calls over the Internet, and performance and security concerns in modern distributed applications.
courses.prerequisites: one of COMP 1006, COMP 1406, SYSC 2004, with a minimum grade of C-

courses.subject: CGSC 1001 A
courses.title: Mysteries of the Mind
courses.description: Challenges faced in understanding the mind, and some of the approaches cognitive science has brought to bear on them. Topics may include the nature of knowledge, how we learn, the extent to which human thinking is rational, biases in thinking, and evolutionary influences on cognition.

courses.subject: CGSC 2001 B
courses.title: Introduction to Cognitive Science
courses.description: An integrated background of the discipline of Cognitive Science, with an historical overview (1940's onward) and examination of the extent to which the discipline has assimilated the collective knowledge of contributing disciplines (e.g., psychology, philosophy, linguistics, artificial intelligence and neuroscience).
courses.prerequisites: second-year standing or permission of the Institute

courses.subject: PHIL 1200 A
courses.title: The Meaning of Life
courses.description: An introduction to concerns expressed by the perennial philosophical question, What is the meaning of life? Students will be familiarized with the major philosophical approaches to life's meaning through a consideration of various contemporary and late modern works in the philosophy of life.

courses.subject: PHIL 1200 A
courses.title: The Meaning of Life
courses.description: An introduction to concerns expressed by the perennial philosophical question, What is the meaning of life? Students will be familiarized with the major philosophical approaches to life's meaning through a consideration of various contemporary and late modern works in the philosophy of life.
